assignment

Class Menu

  • java.lang.Object
    • assignment.Menu

  • public class Menu
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains the details of all 4 kinds of menu items, i.e. desserts, main course items, drinks and set packages. The maximum number of each kind of menu item is specified.
    Author:
    salonigupta

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addDessert()
      addDessert() writes the details of a new dessert to be added into the menu.
      void addDrink()
      addDrink() writes the details of a new drink to be added into the menu.
      void addMainCourseItem()
      addMainCourseItem() writes the details of a new main course item to be added into the menu.
      void addSetPackage()
      addSetPackage() writes the details of a new set package to be added into the menu.
      void editDessert()
      editDessert() edits the details of a dessert by taking input of a dessert name, and asking for new details inside the array of objects of Dessert.
      void editDrink()
      editDrink() edits the details of a drink by taking input of a drink name, and asking for new details inside the array of objects of Drink.
      void editMainCourse()
      editMainCourse() edits the details of a main course item by taking input of a main course item name, and asking for new details inside the array of objects of MainCourse.
      void editSetPackage()
      editSetPackage() edits the details of a set package by taking input of a set package name, and asking for new details inside the array of objects of SetPackage.
      void printDesserts()
      printDesserts() prints the data of all the desserts, if there are any.
      void printDrinks()
      printDrinks() prints the data of all the drinks, if there are any.
      void printMainCourse()
      printMainCourse() prints the data of all the main course items, if there are any.
      void printSetPackages()
      printSetPackages() prints the data of all the set packages, if there are any.
      void readDessertData()
      readDessertData() reads the details of desserts from the text file and loads it in an array of objects of class Dessert.
      void readDrinkData()
      readDrinkData() reads the details of a drink from the text file and loads it in an array of objects of class Drink.
      void readMainCourseData()
      readMainCourseData() reads the details of main course items from the text file and loads it in an array of objects of class MainCourse.
      void readSetPackageData()
      readSetPackageData() reads the details of set packages from the text file and loads it in an array of objects of class SetPackage.
      void removeDessert()
      removeDessert() removes a dessert item from the menu by setting its existence to false inside array of objects of class Dessert.
      void removeDrink()
      removeDrink() removes a drink from the menu by setting its existence to false inside array of objects of Drink.
      void removeMainCourse()
      removeMainCourse() removes a main course item from the menu by setting its existence to false inside array of objects of class MainCourse.
      void removeSetPackage()
      removeSetPackage() removes a set package from the menu by setting its existence to false inside array of objects of SetPackage.
      Dessert[] returnDessert()
      Returns the details of the dessert items.
      Drink[] returnDrink()
      Returns the details of the drinks.
      MainCourse[] returnMainCourse()
      Returns the details of the main course items.
      int returnMaxNumOfDessert()
      Returns the number of maximum desserts that can exist in the menu.
      int returnMaxNumOfDrink()
      Returns the number of maximum drinks that can exist in the menu.
      int returnMaxNumOfMainCourse()
      Returns the number of maximum main course items that can exist in the menu.
      int returnMaxNumOfSetPackage()
      Returns the number of maximum set packages that can exist in the menu.
      int returnNumOfDessert()
      Returns the number of desserts that actually exist in the menu.
      int returnNumOfDrink()
      Returns the number of drinks that actually exist in the menu.
      int returnNumOfMainCourse()
      Returns the number of main course items that actually exist in the menu.
      int returnNumOfSetPackage()
      Returns the number of set packages that actually exist in the menu.
      SetPackage[] returnSetPackage()
      Returns the details of the set packages

      • editDessert

        public void editDessert()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        editDessert() edits the details of a dessert by taking input of a dessert name, and asking for new details inside the array of objects of Dessert. Now, the updated data is rewritten on the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • editMainCourse

        public void editMainCourse()
                    throws java.io.IOException
        editMainCourse() edits the details of a main course item by taking input of a main course item name, and asking for new details inside the array of objects of MainCourse. Now, the updated data is rewritten on the file.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
